<description type="note">Preliminaries and introductory material omitted<lb/>The following plays have been taken from this source:</description>

Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.

herodes rex Now am I sett at mete and wurthely servyd at my degre Com forth knyghtys sytt down and ete and be as mery as ?e kan be. ius miles Lord at ?owre byddynge we take oure sete with herty wyl obey we the Ã¾er is no lorde of myght so grett thorwe all Ã¾is werde in no countre In Wurchepp to a-byde. Herodes I was nevyr meryer here be-forn Sythe Ã¾at I was fyrst born than I am now ryght in Ã¾is morn in joy I gynne to glyde. Mors Ow I herde a page make preysyng of pride all prynces he passyth he wenyth of powste he wenyth to be Ã¾e wurthyest of all Ã¾is werde wyde kynge ovyr All kyngys Ã¾at page wenyth to be He sent into bedlem to seke on every syde Cryst for to qwelle yf Ã¾ei myght hym se but of his wykkyd wyl lurdeyn ?itt he lyede goddys sone doth lyve Ã¾er is no lorde but he Ouer all lordys he is kynge I am deth goddys masangere All myghty god hath sent me here ?on lordeyn to Sle with-owtyn dwere ffor his wykkyd werkynge. I am sent fro god deth is my name All thynge Ã¾at is on grownd I welde at my wylle both man and beste and byrdys wylde and tame Whan Ã¾at I come them to with deth I do them kylle Erbe gres and tres stronge take hem all in same ?a Ã¾e grete myghty Okys with my dent I spylle what man Ã¾at I wrastele with he xal ryght sone haue schame I ?eve hym such a trepett he xal evyr more ly stylle Ffor deth kan no sporte wher I smyte Ã¾er is no grace Ffor aftere my strook man hath no space to make amendys ffor his trespace but god hym graunt comforte Ow se how prowdely ?on kaytyff sytt at mete of deth hath he no dowte he wenyth to leve evyr-more to hym wyl I go and ?eve hym such An hete Ã¾at all Ã¾e lechis of Ã¾e londe his lyf xul nevyr restore A-?ens my dredful dentys it vaylyth nevyr to plete or I hym part fro I xal hym make ful pore All Ã¾e blood of his body I xal hym owt swete Ffor now I go to sle hym with strokys sad and sore Bothe hym and his knyghtys all Ã¾is tyde I xal hem make to me but thrall with my spere sle hem I xall. and so cast down his pride herodes Rex Now kende knyghtys be mery and glad With all good diligens shewe now sum myrth Ffor be gracyous mahound more myrth never I had ne nevyr more joye was inne from tyme of my byrth Ffor now my fo is ded and prendyd as a padde aboue me is no kynge on grownd nere on gerth merthis Ã¾erfore make ?e and be ryght no thynge sadde spare nother mete nor drynke and spare for no dyrthe of wyne nor of brede Ffor now am I a kynge alone So wurthy as I may Ã¾er be none Ã¾erfore knyghtys be mery echone ffor now my ffo is dede. ius miles Whan Ã¾e boys sprawlyd at my sperys hende by sathanas oure syre it was a goodly syght A good game it was Ã¾at boy for to shende Ã¾at wolde abene oure kynge and put ?ow from ?our ryght ijus miles Now trewly my lorde Ã¾e kynge we had ben vn-hende and nevyr non of us Able for to be a knyght If Ã¾at Any of us to hem had ben a frende and asavyd Any lyff a-?en Ã¾i mekyl myght Ffrom deth hem to flytt. herodes Rex Amonges all Ã¾at grett rowthte he is ded I haue no dowte Ã¾erfore menstrell rownd a-bowte blowe up a mery fytt. Hic dum buccinant mors interficiat herodem et duos milites subito et diabolus recipiat eos. Diabolus All oure all oure Ã¾is catel is myn I xall hem brynge on to my celle I xal hem teche pleys fyn and showe such myrthe as is in helle It were more bettyr Amonges swyn Ã¾at evyr more stynkyn Ã¾er be to dwelle ffor in oure logge is so gret peyn Ã¾at non erthely tonge can telle with ?ow I go my way I xal ?ow bere forth with me and shewe ?ow sportys of oure gle of oure myrthis now xal ?e se and evyr synge welawey. Mors Off kynge herowde all men beware Ã¾at hath rejoycyd in pompe and pryde Ffor all his boste of blysse ful bare he lyth now ded here on his syde Ffor whan I come I can not spare Fro me no whyht may hym hyde now is he ded and cast in care In helle pytt evyr to A-byde his lordchep is al lorn Now is he as pore as I wormys mete is his body his sowle in helle ful peynfully of develis is al to-torn. All men dwellyng upon Ã¾e grownde Be-ware of me be myn councel Ffor feynt felachep in me is fownde I kan no curtesy as I ?ow tel Ffor be a man nevyr so sownde of helth in herte nevyr so wel I come sodeynly with-in a stownde me with-stande may no castel my jurnay wyl I spede. of my comyng no man is ware Ffor when men make most mery fare Ã¾an sodeynly I cast hem in care and sle Ã¾em evyn in dede. Thow I be nakyd and pore of array and wurmys knawe me al a-bowte ?it loke ?e drede me nyth and day Ffor whan deth comyth ?e stande in dowte Evyn lyke to me as I ?ow say shull all ?e be here in Ã¾is rowte Whan I ?ow chalange at my day I xal ?ow make ryght lowe to lowth and nakyd for to be Amonges wormys as I ?ow telle Vndyr Ã¾e erth xul ?e dwelle and thei xul Etyn both flesch and felle As Ã¾ei haue don me.
